intro: Manettia reclinata, commonly known as the hanging manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its pendulous clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy texture. Manettia reclinata typically grows as an epiphyte or scrambler, often found in shaded, humid environments.
